MechaNika is a pretty straightforward game. Your objective is to gather different machine parts to make your plan of destroying most of the world a reality. I found the game very enjoyable and the puzzles not that hard to figure out. Unlike other adventure games, you don't have to gather countless items and combine them in a specific manner to make some small progress, all it takes are usually one or two items and you're set.

36231143.review:
Eh. I mean it’s ok but kinda just boring

[h1]Story:[/h1]
You’re a little girl who wants to take over the world so you collect parts for world domination. You do this by interacting with people from around your town in the standard adventure game way of clicking through dialog options. The entire story (except for the last cutscene) is literally just you collecting parts so it’s not the deepest plot. The characters, on the other hand, are somewhat interesting but just surface level. Each of them usually have their own quirk and one of them is pretty funny but the rest have a couple of lines of dialog and you never talk to them again.

Also, the story tries to be dark in bits by either cursing or having “adult” content and it’s an interesting in theory because the art style is super cute (pour one out for juxtaposition). However, it happens so infrequently the the game seems inconsistent rather than having an undercurrent of dark humor.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1]
It’s an adventure game. Talk to people, collect items and build stuff. It’s not a bad game in this regard as the puzzles mostly actually make sense and the logic is easy to follow. The controls for faster movement are a pain as it’s hard to stop but it was fine.

[h1]Graphics/Performance: (with a 970, 4790K, 16GB of RAM, SSD)[/h1]
Looks great, ran great, and never crashed. Love the art style.
 
[h1]Final Thoughts:[/h1]
I didn’t hate it but it kind of just happened. I got to the end and was like “Well ok.” If you’re into adventure games, give it a shot as it’s quite cheap but the story just seemed lacking.

What a weird game. What an exceptionally weird game. I've finished it and I'm not even sure what to say, or whether it deserves a thumbs up or thumbs down. Here's what's going on in the game--you can make up your own mind:

1) This game has a cute overlay but the story and the other little surprises peppered throughout the game are not cute. NOT CUTE.  I won't spoil it for you, but I will say this is not a game for children. I'm 33 and I am not entirely sure I was prepared for a few of the things I stumbled over.

2) Most of the puzzles are logical. I like that--I have trouble with point & click games where the puzzles are solved by a ridiculous series of things that you can't possibly come up with on your own.

3) You're working toward something very interesting the entire game. [spoiler] The game ends before you get to the very interesting thing.  [/spoiler]

4) The hint feature doesn't really work. You have to be standing in the exact right place for hints to help you. IF I KNEW WHERE THAT WAS I WOULDN'T NEED A STUPID HINT WOULD I? Ahem. (Okay yeah so I said they're logical in #2. They are. That doen't mean that *I* am always a logical thinker, okay?! Back off.).

5) You cannot get all achievements in the first playthrough. I don't care at all about that in any way, shape, or form; but I have friends in my steam list that would. This point is for you. You know who you are. The game is not good enough to play through more than once. 

6) They've mispelled their own bundle "Pyschotic Adventures." This is neither good nor bad it's just still bothering me and I feel obligated to point it out.

35766519.review:
TLDR: Cute game with a great atmosphere. There are some glaring issues with the game but none of them are deal breakers and the game is pretty cheap so I’d recommend it.

This is MechaNika, a point and click adventure game about bringing out Armageddon. You are Nika, the cute girl who is secretly evil. She doesn't fall into the trope of using cuteness to trick people, instead she's a super nerd who loves machines and mechanics. What i love about this game is the characters and the dialog are well done (except the dev self inserts). The entire world has this cutesy (chibi?) art style and then contrasts it with some really messed up characters and the game really pushes it's world.


As seen in the trailer there is a curvy font that is very difficult to read. It's a detail that makes no sense to keep in a game, as the curvy font is functionally unusable. However I think this is a good way to show the games commitment to making an interesting universe. 

The gameplay is the game's weakness. The point and click formula works well with the theme and the story but it's very basic. None of the puzzles grow beyond "use item A to do item B" and while these puzzles are great every once the game never evolves past them. Also at least one puzzle almost made me quit with it's ridiculous solution. [spoiler] In one of the first parts of the game you are stuck in a schoolyard with only 2 areas to move around in: the schoolyard and the bathroom. In the schoolyard there is an electric fence, and once you've talked to every NPC there wasn't a clear goal presented to me so i figured i needed to get past the electric fence. After 10 minutes of trying to use paper towels and spray paint to somehow open the gate, I spray-paint a door in the bathroom. It turns out this is the way to make the story progress. This almost made me quit the game within the first half hour, the existence of the electric gate and the lack of direction from the game meant that unless you use the hint system you would naturally be stuck clicking on the gate until you got bored and quit. Just a really unintuitive way to progress very early on in the game.[/spoiler] 

There are some more minor complaints i have with the game. To bring up the backpack you have to click on Nika, to leave the backpack you can either click on Nika's face in the top left of hit "esc." If you've played any other video game, "esc" probably is the more natural way for you to access your inventory, but you can't use "esc" to bring up the backpack, only to put it away. Felt really clunky. There's also a completely useless save function due to autosaving, and Nika herself even mentions the save function is useless. If the devs knew the save function was useless, why keep it in except in case of bugs. Finally, I really don't like how much stuff exists in the world that you cannot interact with. In the hallway next to your room there are two really cool decorations I wanted to get Nika's input on, but you can't click on them. There isn't any real indication on what is interactable, so seeing a cool object that you can't interact with felt really disappointing.

What the game does really well is build an atmosphere. Every character has issues, some are immediately recognizable and some you must talk to the character to figure out. Many characters seem to have this tragic feel to them, like they all want to be good people but struggle to get past their personal issues. In dealing with those issues, these characters will either ignore or disrespect you as you aren't a factor in their lives. This becomes especially clear when [spoiler] Nika's mother completely ignores her to watch tv. [/spoiler] The personal struggle of a lot of these characters leads to them being rather self-centered and give Nika a good incentive to rain death on them all, which is just a great story to depress you.

While we are talking about her, I love how the game fitted Nika's character into the world. With her whole "i want to destroy the world" spiel you expect her to hate every character but she gets along well with a mechanic and a lonely kid who worships(?) meat. Both characters Nika can relate to and it seems natural given her positive demeaner that she would make some friends in this town. It's a small detail that adds depth to the game world and to Nika's character.

Overall the game is delivers a very strong world in a point and click adventure game. Really creative and well executed characters and atmosphere to the game, but I would have loved to see more from the puzzles and the general gameplay. Regardless, if anything I said sounds interesting give the game a shot.

35286322.review:
[i]MechaNika[/i] initially presents itself as a cute children's adventure game but quickly turns dark, as pervasive adult themes slowly permeate the game to an absurd extent. This is a point and click style game with simple puzzles and basic conversation trees. The art style and soundtrack play a stark contrast to the premise of the story; the protagonist, Nika, is a 7 year old girl with dreams of taking over the world due to her internalised conflict - that she tries to hide with a smile - for being neglected by all of the important people in her life.

There are a huge amount of pop culture influences and references littered throughout, some more obscure than others. Whether this destroys the immersion depends on the player but, personally, I found myself undecided on how I felt about certain situations, such as the obvious Matrix references that break the fourth wall as they were too far too "on the nose" for my liking.

The town and characters of [i]MechaNika[/i] are quite charming but something needs to be said about how unnecessarily hypersexualised I found certain parts. I'm fine with contextually appropriate adult themes but there is a significant amount of focus towards spontaneous nudity and fornication, to the point where graphic sexual acts and genitals are either displayed or described in full. These sections of the game really stand out, especially the story of Nika's grandfather, despite other parts of the game showing graphic violence. It's just that the violent parts of the game generally had believable context to go along with them, such as the Religion of Carnivorism slaughtering willing animals.

The story ends on a bit of a cliffhanger, right as Nika achieves her goal, with [i]MechaNika[/i] intending to be part of an overarching series. It is a very quick game where the first playthrough took me about 3 hours to complete and a subsequent run, to unlock all achievements, clocked in at another 20 minutes after knowing exactly what to do.

[i]MechaNika[/i] runs in Java, a horrible engine for games which has serious limitations and tends to cause so many issues with various PC setups. Trying to capture this game with OBS to stream on Twitch was a chore as the game window didn't conform to my native screen resolution, nor would it appropriately fit within the capture window of OBS. There are no audio settings other than on/off so, when the game starts out extremely loud, the only way to reduce the volume is through my PC's volume mixer.

[i]MechaNika[/i] is a facetious, funny, charming little game that completely misrepresents itself on purpose. There are awkward scenes and unrelatable characters throughout but that doesn't stop [i]MechaNika[/i] from being a competent point and click adventure game.

View my [url=https://www.twitch.tv/collections/hSGWZ2O16BRhWQ]playthrough of MechaNika[/url] on Twitch.

32953623.review:
Ника – немного странная 7-летняя девочка. Она увлекается механикой, пьёт какао с коньяком, а в стене её комнаты - дыра-проход в секретную лабораторию. Нет, она не маленькая злодейка. Она просто крутая. И она уничтожит в этом мире всё отстойное.

Брат – помешан на компьютерных играх и сестра ей только мешает. Мама повёрнута на ток-шоу и вообще, кажется, не обращает на Нику внимания. Бабушка ненавидит дедушку. Школа выглядит как тюрьма, а ученики к поведению Ники относятся как к чему-то инородному. Нике это всё осточертело, и она запускает свой проект по уничтожению всего отстойного – «МехаНика».

На своём пути Ника повстречает кучу странноватых, карикатурных и чудаковатых героев. Каждый из них по-своему запоминается. Персонажи странные, и в то же время в них угадываются типажи из реальности, и, увы, типажи не самые лучшие. Через призму странного и забавного игра пытается, и пытается успешно, показать проблемы нашего с вами общества, а Ника, несмотря на свои странности, оказывается среди всего этого сброда самым адекватным человеком. Игра очень успешно рассказывает о серьёзном с хорошим юмором, а это – своего рода искусство.

Особо радует тот факт, что разработчики абсолютно в каждой детали учли, что в игре мы смотрим на мир глазами 7-летней девочки. Диалоги простые и забавные, и не выглядят какими-то слишком взрослыми для ребёнка. Рисовка очень простая и так же придаёт аутентичности, ибо вся игра выглядит как сборник милых детских рисунков.

Особенно качественная работа была проведена над…интерфейсом. В начале игры Ника обращается к нам и рассказывает, как здесь всё устроено. Просмотреть инвентарь можно кликнув по её голове, там же лежит несколько вещей, которые она всегда носит с собой, и каждая из них отвечает за конкретную игровую функцию. Особенно порадовала фляга с её любимым напитком из кофе и коньяка, выпив которую она «прозреет» и выдаст нам подсказку на случай если умудрились застрять.

В плане геймплея же перед нами классический Point & Click квест. У нас есть список предметов, которые нужно осуществить для осуществления плана Ники. Добывать их придётся методом решения несложных задачек. Они местами диковаты по содержанию, но несмотря на это логичны и не заставляют героиню комбинировать водку, лестницу и сапог. Ему только мешают большие локации и отсутствие быстрого перемещения между ними. В нашем распоряжении целый, пусть даже и не очень большой, городок, и иногда приходится перемещаться из одного конца в другой, что довольно продолжительно даже если передвигаться исключительно бегом.

Приятный квест на вечер-два, способный улыбнуть и в то же время заставить задуматься. Рекомендуется к приобретению любителям жанра и, помните – не будьте отстойными!

31237438.review:
I'm very ambivalent about the game, it's a Mixed, no a clear No.

[h1]The good:[/h1]

+ Nice visual style
+ Mostly player-friendly gameplay
+ Nice minimalistic music
+ Some humorous lines
+ Pop culture references
+ The game is kinda short, you can finish your first playthrough in around 2 hours

[h1]Mixed:[/h1]

~ The developers appear in the game, and can have a conversation with the protagonist, which is mildly amusing, but I felt the protagonist going on and on about how the devs' previous game is her favourite somewhat hamfisted and annoying.

~ The default font type is basically illegible, but the other font option is quite good both in legibility and feel.

[h1]The bad:[/h1]

- Reeeeaaally fucked up characters. Just some of the things in the game: [spoiler]satanist butcher ritual with "self-sacrificing" animals, alcoholic 7-years old protagonist, the protagonist's video-game addict grandma murdering the zoophile grandfather, and the "best", the protagonist preserved the body of her own stillborn baby sister in a jar as decoration[/spoiler]. In general most characters (including the protagonist) are total @ssholes.

- There's a transphobic joke character (who is also misgendered by the protagonist), but as most characters in the game are basically parodies of the people they depict (TV-addicted mother, self-deluding meat-eater, pervert grandpa), I can't even get upset about that one character in particular.

- Bad hint system. I got really stuck at one point when the game just kept giving the hint that I should get on the bus, but at the same time it didn't let me get on the bus. I spent about 10-15 frustrating minutes walking back and forth, trying everything I could think of, before resorting to a guide.

- The game on two occasions is expecting you to repeat an action that didn't yield a result on the first try, before it gives a different outcome. These were one of the cases where I needed the guide. In general I think this is a bad game design choice.

- You have to play the game through at least twice to unlock all achievements. (At least the second playthrough only took me an hour.)

- The game feels kinda unfinished. [spoiler]You build the giant murder-robot, aaand... the game just fades into white, the end. There is only some implied destruction seen as a distant mushroom cloud by one of the NPCs.[/spoiler] No emotional resolution, nothing. The game overall feels very shallow, almost an exercise by the devs to make something edgy and lulz without any depth.

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
If you don't mind, or downright [i]like[/i] messed up characters and stories, you will have a field day with this one. The gameplay and technical quality are player-friendly. Avoid, if you are not amused by parody characters, people behaving as @ssholes, and/or don't like cartoon gore.

31209680.review:
Es una pena haber tenido una expectativa tan alta en algo que al final peca de ser ridículamente transgresor. El conflicto en la trama de Mechanika es de lo más interesante: una niña que quiere destruir lo que no le gusta en su vida. Creo que todos hemos fantaseado con eso alguna vez de niños, y el descenlace para una historia así es bastante impredecible; dos motivos grandes para darle una oportunidad a este point-and-click. Sin embargo, los demás personajes parecen reducidos a la falacia del hombre de paja solo para hacer parecer a Nika la voz de la razón. No es como si no se pudiesen hacer buenas historias narradas a través de los ojos de un niño: ahí tenemos al Pequeño Nicolás o hasta El Principito.

Otro de los problemas que tiene es uno de los aspectos de los que el juego se jacta: referencias a la cultura geek. No digo que no esté mal ponerlas de vez en cuando, pero en MechaNika se hace al punto de que estas ya no son referencias, sino elementos que afectan el desarrollo del juego -elementos que pudieron ser reemplazados con unos de autoría propia que, quién sabe, pudieron haber impactado tanto que ahora ellos serían usados como referencias en otros medios. No se tomó el riesgo de crear muchas cosas nuevas, y eso provoca que la historia se sienta más como una recopilación de referencias que una historia original.

No tengo ningún problema en que se haya decidido usar un diseño de personajes tan simple -obviamente inspirado en Pendleton Ward y Hora de Aventura-, que de hecho le sienta bastante bien a una historia que se supone está contada por un niño. El diseño de fondos, sin embargo, es en exceso simple. Los objetos no se sienten reales, ni siquiera para el estilo simplificado que usaron.

Lo único rescatable de MechaNika son, como dije antes, su premisa original, su diseño de personajes, y su banda sonora. Guillem Vilamala  logró un buen trabajo en capturar la escencia de cada escenario en un loop que se adecuara a él, y eso es de admirar, porque incluso juegos que admiro como Skullgirls no logran hacerlo del todo bien.

Si eres muy exigente con los argumentos en un videojuego (que, la verdad sea dicha, lo son todo en un videojuego de este género) no te lo recomiendo. Si lo que quieres es una aventura edgy con la que puedas fácilmente identificarte, este es tu juego.

29524957.review:
Příběh o sedmileté dívce, která chce zničit vše, co není cool.

[h1]Stavíme robota[/h1]
Hned zkraje chci říct jednu věc. Tahle hra rozhodně není pro děti. O tom se více rozepíšu až dále... V adventuře MechaNika se ujmete role malé sedmileté holčičky, která se rozhodne zničit na světě vše, co není cool. Jelikož rozumí technice a místo panenek si hraje se šroubováky, kladivem apod., vytvoří plán na vyrobení robota. A hlavním úkolem hry je získat určité předměty, díky kterým se vám povede tento zázrak technologie přivést k životu.

Příběh působí vtipně a zajímavě, bohužel ke konci ztratí dech a následující kopanec do rozkroku vydýchá snad málokdo. Abych to uvedl na pravou míru, hra končí v tom nejlepším okamžiku, na který jste celé ty tři nebo dvě hodiny čekali. Tohle opravdu nemám rád. Závěr je tedy velice neuspokojivý. Co ale zbytek hry?

[h1]Lehká adventura[/h1]
Jak jsem psal již nahoře, hra Mechanika je adventura. Nečekejte ale žádné složité hledání předmětů nebo procházení desítek lokací. Tenhle titul staví na jednoduchosti, tudíž tu máte jen pár částí ulice, pár budov, do kterých můžete vstoupit a smetiště. I samotné sbírání nebo hledání předmětů je jednoduché, jelikož většina použitelných věcí bije do očí. Přiznám se, že zpočátku jsem netušil, co dělat a byl jsem jemně zmatený. Jakmile jsem se ale rozkoukal, nebyl problém hru dokončit do dvou hodin.

Kromě hlavní hrdinky tu ale máte i její rodinu a pár dalších postav, se kterými můžete vést rozhovor. Drtivá většina z nich vám dá nějaký předmět nebo má jiné důležité využití ve hře. Bohužel dialogy jsou další slabou stránkou Mechaniky. Jsou nudné. A to tak, že jsem je velmi brzy začal přeskakovat. Navíc se na obrazovce zobrazují po jedné větě, kterou musíte vždy odkliknout.

[h1]18+[/h1]
Hra se snaží být i vtipná, což jde vidět už v oněch rozhovorech. Zde ale pokus o humor selhává. Jen párkrát jsem se opravdu od srdce zasmál. No a pak tu je nahota a obsah pro dospělé. Když jsem procházel kolem lehkých žen (Steam mi cenzuruje ono slovo na P), z nichž jedna na mě vrtěla penisem a druhá si vyhrnula sukni a ukázala mi víte co, zarazil jsem se. Grafickou stylizací a i hratelností působí spíše jako taková roztomilá hříčka pro děti, ale ve skutečnosti je spíše pro dospělé publikum. A i když to může vyznít divně, tvůrci jakoby sami netušili, na jaké straně chtějí tento titul mít.

Ona je totiž rozpolcená, kdy na jednu stranu je vhodná pro děti, jenže na druhou nabízí určité okamžiky, které rozhodně NEJSOU vhodné pro děti. Díky tomu nemůže plně zaujmout ani jednu skupinu hráčů.

[h1]Jsme připraveni zahájit zničení světa[/h1]
Grafická stylizace i hudba jsou výborné, skvěle sem sedí a nemám k nim žádné výtky. Cena je také rozumná, zvlášť pokud se vám podaří vychytat slevu. Co se týče jazyků, hra bohužel nabízí jen angličtinu, ruštinu a španělštinu. Umím si představit, že byste ji mohli hrát i jen tak, bez znalosti děje. Jenže to byste se ochudili o pár vtipů.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ hra je lehčí
+ kvalitní audiovizuální zpracování
+ příjemná atmosféra
+ občas nějaký ten vtip

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- příběh je degradován koncem, který je plivnutím do tváře všem hráčům
- dialogy jsou nezajímavé
- obsah pro dospělé
- délka hry
- hra postrádá hloubku

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 6/10[/b]

Mechanika je lehce nadprůměrná adventura, která vypadá jako pro děti, ale rozhodně pro děti není. Je škoda, že se tvůrci nerozhodli, jestli chtějí vytvořit titul pro dospělé lidi nebo pro děti. Takhle skončili někde na půl cesty a moc tomu nepřidává ani konec hry, který je na facku.

29318053.review:
[Многа букаф]
Небольшой 2D квест с рисовкой, напоминающей Adventure Time и Castle Crashers, про 7-летнюю девочку по имени Ника, решившуюся уничтожить всё "некрутое" и изменить мир так, как ей заблагорасудится. А ещё коньяк с какао пьет временами (родителям всё равно на Нику, как и брату её, из-за недостатка внимания вот и вздумалось разрушить весь мир) Ребенок, что сказать, хоть и очень умный - читает книги про сложные технологии, любит и умеет чинить и создавать различные машины [spoiler](к примеру, ГИГАНТСКОГО РОБОТА, СПОСОБНОГО ПРИКОНЧИТЬ ВСЁ ЧЕЛОВЕЧЕСТВО, СОЗДАННОГО ИЗ ПРЕДМЕТОВ БЫТА) [/spoiler]. Много черного юмора, сатира повсюду, какую локацию не посетишь. Интересные и странные (в хорошем смысле) персонажи([spoiler]Чего стоит Агата, единственная подруга Ники и главный пророк Мясоедения[/spoiler]).
После игры осталось приятное впечатление, и неудивительно - ведь сделана она с душой, сразу видно. Кстати, хороший саундтрек, успешно передающий атмосферу происходящего (купил - не пожалел, да и стоит мало, 30 рублей всего лишь). 
Игру рекомендую и очень, [b]но[/b] прежде скажу, что её лучше всего проходить не на скорость, а уделять внимание деталям (всё равно игра очень короткая, так что если вы сразу пойдете за главной целью, то насладитесь лишь малой частью игры) - кликать на каждый кликабельный предмет, говорить с каждым человеком, пробовать всевозможные комбинации. Удачи, и помните - время МехаНики пришло ;)

29086301.review:
[h1]MechaNika[/h1]  небольшой квест, где вам предстоит помочь Нике семи лет от роду стать МехаНикой и уничтожить всё отстойное в мире, попутно закидываясь смесью какао с коньяком. 

Игра проходится часа за два - три, и не успевает надоесть, что немаловажно для квеста. Загадки все вполне логичны, но  осознание этого приходит обычно после просмотра мануала, а пользовался я им всего раза два. Степень сложности задач варьируется от простых до средних и парой до средних с подковыркой. Но всегда можно закинуться вышеупомянутой смесью и получить подсказку, только вот достижение за кристальный рассудок уже не получить.

Так же радует и печалит проработанность игры, где можно найти кучу отсылок к разным вещам поп-культуры, и это радует. А вот печалит незаметность некоторых трудов разработчиков. For example, к концу игры мать уходит от телека и уступает место братцу Ники. Саму же мать можно найти в крайне комнате справа на втором этаже. И причины идти туда нет, и найти её там можно разве что случайно наткнувшись или намеренно ведя поиски. И многие пройдут. Пусть это и глупо, если учесть, что такое происходит в подавляющем большинстве игр, но тут обида даже взяла.

В целом игра вышла и весёлой и грустной. Множество шутеек идут рука об руку с грустными моментами, которые можно углядеть и в нашей жизни. Затрагиваются важные темы вроде образования, религии и семьи. 

А ещё в игре можно пообщаться с разрабами и взять у них автографы. 
А ещё в игре замечательный саунд, так что можно не скупиться и взять его тоже.

[h1]Вердикт:[/h1] [i]если ты недостаточно крут - прячься. Если достаточно - покупай MechaNika.[/i]

29035342.review:
MechaNika es una aventura gráfica que desprende una impresión infantil muy fuerte, incluso desde los primeros minutos de juego, pero no es más que una cubierta que esconde peculiaridades ni mucho menos aptas para todos los públicos. A menudo nos encontraremos dosis de humor negro y otras tantas de humor absurdo, y por supuesto no podían faltar las referencias sexuales. Dicho sea de paso también hay referencias a la cultura de internet, los videojuegos, etcétera. Y todo en perfecto castellano (o español de España, como se prefiera llamar), cosa que no sorprende dada la procedencia del estudio desarrollador.

Como aventura es un poco corta y deja con ganas de más, pero es más que correcta por su precio. No es especialmente difícil, la inmensa mayoría de puzles son de lógica pura e incluso hay algún detalle que se puede realizar de varias maneras. Aunque el diseño artístico salta a la vista que es minimalista, encaja perfectamente con la visión que se pretende plasmar. Como suele ser costumbre en los juegos breves, no quiero entrar en demasiados detalles para no descubrir todo lo que tiene que ofrecer este (de hecho ni siquiera recomiendo ver los trailers por la misma razón).

Personalmente me ha gustado bastante, me ha parecido toda una sorpresa y ya tengo en el punto de mira la siguiente aventura de este estudio que por lo visto estará basada en el mismo universo.

28365736.review:
MechaNika is a very funny and charming game about a young girl with aspirations of world domination.

From beginning to end, it delivers satisfying puzzles, on-point humor, cute graphics, and surprisingly dark themes. Do not make the mistake of thinking that this is a game for children -- I promise that it's really not. It often deals with very creepy and adult issues like cults, murder, pickled punks, and very, uh, interesting relationships between humans and animals. If any of this offends you then you're looking at the wrong game.

But if you're thinking "Sign me up!" then you've come to the right place. MechaNika is a real gem of a point and click adventure game. It will keep you laughing the whole time with its witty humor and observations about humanity. The whole game is laid out in such a way that nothing feels too difficult or repetitive. As a result, it's a slightly short game, but that's not really a bad thing because there's no filler to get bogged down in. You're also given a bit of leeway in how you can solve some of the puzzles which is a nice touch.

Definitely recommended. The devs put a lot of love into this game, and it's absolutely worth playing.

27939863.review: Mechanika è una adventure punta e clicca in stile cartoon. Tale stile, che suggerirebbe una certa spenseriatezza infantile, non deve ingannare, poichè lo stile generale dell'opera è quantomai dissacratorio ed amorale: chi è sensibile relativamente a questi aspetti è avvisato.  E certamente non si consiglia tale gioco ai minori più piccoli. La grafica è buona, manca il parlato, il sonoro è accettabile. Qualche enigma non è proprio immediato. L'interazione con lo scenario è minimale, senza la possibilità di fare interagire gli oggetti dell'inventario. La pecca maggiore, secondo me, è che il gioco fa parte della categoria, sempre più popolata untimamente, dei giochi con finale improvviso che lo lascia 'incompiuto', con proseguio di là da venire ( e con gioco successivo da comprare). Questo accompagnato da una durata tutt'altro che lunga. Consigliato se siete disposti a divertirvi ed a ridere delle trovate del gioco e vi trovate in sintonia con esso.

27570428.review:
Una aventura grafica muy bonita y con mucha personalidad. Encarnamos a una chica de 7 años cansada del mundo que le rodea y decide arrasarlo todo y volver a construir un mundo nuevo... Premisa interesante que desarrolla con un humor muy gamberro.

Nika, la protagonista, tiene muchisimo carisma, solo por ella merece la pena darle una oportunidad. La banda sonora es tremenda, le queda de lujo al juego y a pesar de ser en bucle, no te cansas de ella.

Es un juego muy corto, sin mirarte guias ni nada, tardaras unas 2h en completarlo y aun asi, merece la pena invertir tiempo en el juego. Puedes rejugarlo para sacar todos los logros y para seguir disfrutando de un juego muy bonito y amigable visualmente.

Lo vi de casualidad y aprovechando que estaba en oferta y unos centimillos que tenia en la cartera de Steam y que es un juego español, me lo pille.

Nota: 8/10.

25472610.review: The game starts off super cute. The art isn't stunning, but it's cute and simple, and seems almost stylized. The puzzles seem simple enough at first (other than using items not being explained well) but they quickly get much harder. Some of the required steps are just ridiculous and hard to figure out. To access a separate, required area of the game, you have to complete EVERYTHING else, which means every arbitrary little detail.... This is where I stopped playing, because I couldn't access the scrapyard even though I completed everything and referenced multiple walkthroughs. I'm genuinely dissappointed I couldn't finish the game. Honestly, if you're going to get this game - and you should, if you want something to play in small doses - get it on the app store. It's $2 cheaper, which feels more like the value the game should be, and the way the point-and-click controls are set up feels more like a mobile game. Just expect to be very frustrated, even if you do use a walkthrough.

24829804.review:
MechaNika es una aventura gráfica estilo point & click en el que controlaremos a Nika, una niña de 7 años con una capacidad para hacer el mal del estilo del pequeño Stewie Griffin de Padre de Familia.

Pros:
- Humor presente en todas partes (en algunos momentos bastante bestia).
- Bastantes guiños a marcas, conductas y situaciones reales de la sociedad.

Contras:
- Muy baja dificultad en general.
- Excesivamente corta.
- Que te acabes el juego al 100% y aun no te hayan dado todos sus cromos.

Conclusión: MechaNika es una aventura gráfica clásica bastante corta y fácil que puede gustar a todos los fans del género a los que les guste el humor más desenfadado y bruto (en ocasiones humor negro). 24394205.review:
[i]MechaNika[/i] is a short point and click adventure where puzzles are -for the most part- logical and straightforward.
It took me almost 4 hours to finish my first play-through, and a big part of that was trying to figure out the only puzzle I found to be illogical. If you are faced with the same difficulty, maybe Achievements name can give you a clue.
A second complete play-through, where I aimed for the remaining achievements, took just 35 minutes.

The game premise may give a hint of a dark, weird world. And that's exactly what you get. Nika, a 7 year-old, is faced with themes as alcohol, violence and sex... weird sex, you don't want to know about it. I found it as borderline inappropriate as funny. There is some clever writing in here, specially the dialogue with certain couple that seem to know too much about the world Nika lives in.

At first, I was not enjoying the graphic style and the cumbersomeness of actions and controls. Changing resolution in-game had some unpredictable behavior for me (I could never get back to Full HD) so I resorted to the configuration file. Disabling that big mouse cursor and changing the font made a great impact, and I finally settled on the weirdness of the graphics. After all, they match with the bizarre story and cast of characters.

I would have liked to see more work in the sound aspect. There is no background sound and sound effects are really limited. Music is cheerful and cute, I'll give them that. There are, however, multiple dialogue options, which I appreciate.
It also includes cards and achievements which are not really hard to get. Cards took a while to drop, tough.

In terms of structure, this review has been a failure. But I would like to conclude saying that, considering its price tag, I recommend this game!


Edit: Added [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/steamoff/screenshots/?appid=384680]screenshots[/url].

Ein ziemlich verrücktes Spiel, irgendwie auch ganz schön krank.

Man spielt Nika, 7 Jahre alt, genervt, missachtet, übersehen oder falsch behandelt von allem und jedem.
Was macht man da? Richtig, auf alle scheissen und mit einem Mecha versuchen die Welt zu zerstören.
Also muss Nika jetzt alle Teile dafür zusammenkriegen um endlich diese böse Welt auszulöschen.

DIe Spieldauer war ok, man sollte sich die Zeit nehmen die Umgebung und die Dialoge zu beachten. Sehr zynisch und voll schwarzem Humor.

Weiterhin gibt es Errungenschaften und Sammelkarten. Wobei man für erstere nicht nur einfach durchspielen muss.

Insgesamt gutes Spiel.

23861594.review:
Ok, so, for starters, I just figured I should put out a message that the game [i]is[/i] episodic, which is something I didn't know when I purchased it but it was cheap so it's all good.

This game, of the limited selection of point and clicks i've played, is definitely the one that not only made the most sense (not really any of that inverted adventure game logic here) but it's also the most fucked in the head, and in a good way. The world Mango Protocol have made for the game is one that at first glance at is at least a reasonable facsimile of normal life, but you'll soon find it's full of perverts and general weirdos, just going about their lives. You play as one of these weirdos, Nika, a seven year old girl who is on a mission to build a death robot and purge everything that isn't awesome. Isn't that awesome?

The game plays nicely enough, but it was obviously made with touch screens in mind (which isn't a bad thing, btw, quite the opposite) and after a patch the graphics options are enough to satisfy. The games controls are easy to learn and easier to use, and to be frank there's not much I can fault about the game. People say the ending is bad, but you've gotta factor in the episodic nature of the game, and to be honest it left me hyped for Mango Protocol's future games, Agatha Knife and Colossus Down, which are further continuations/extended bits of the MechaNika story (at least I think they are, not too sure). The art is nicely done, with a kinda doodle-y aesthetic which does well to hide the fucked up parts, and make them all the more fucked up. Soundtrack's good too.
But yeah, I'd definitely pick this one up (well i did but y'know) and be on the lookout for any of Mango Protocols future games, if they're up to this one's standard.

22723040.review:
MechaNika is a game about a bright little girl named Nika who hates her school and most of society. It is a lighthearted point and click adventure of her actions to create a device to reshape the world.

First off, this is definitely NOT a kid’s game. Although the game looks very child friendly and downright cartoonish, there are many situations, characters, and dialogs that are way out there. As mentioned, the graphics are nothing spectacular and can be considered a little lazy at times. Still I think the design fits the story better than high resolution graphics would. 

The music in this game is good. There are a couple of really good scores in some of the locations. However, they are all quite short and repeat quickly. Especially if you are going back and forth between different locations a lot.
The controls are pretty standard. You mouse over something and you have options based on the item. You click on Nika and you can access your inventory, setting, or help.

The game is quite short. The first time through it will take a few hours just to figure out how some of the puzzles work and the order of running around. After that, you will be able to complete the game in under an hour. Considering the price of this game and the extra elements, it is definitely worth the price.

The worst things I can really say about the game are. First the start of the game tutorial. Unless I missed something, it is completely un-skippable and is very slow. Once you get out of the classroom, the game speeds up. The second is the main menu and settings. 

There are no advanced settings for this game. There are a couple of simple items like changing the resolution, sound, and type of mouse pointer. For me resolution was the hardest thing to work with. I have my PC connected to a 4K TV and it did not want to work with any resolution I clicked through. In the end, I had to manually set my resolution via editing the preferences file. Once I did that, I had no more issues with video.

Ultimately this is a great demented point and click adventure. Hopefully there will be a sequel!

22504173.review:
[h1]Все некрутые вещи исчезнут. Если ты недостаточно крут - прячься. Настало время МехаНики.[/h1]

MechaNika - это 2D квест в жанре Point-and-Click, который разработан и выпущен небольшой компанией Mango Protocol.
Здесь мы играем за семилетнюю девочку по имени Ника, которая любит мастерить и изучать электронику и механику.  В один не очень прекрасный день Ника не выдерживает своих житейских проблем и решает наконец воплотить в жизнь свой проект "МехаНика", который поможет ей избавить мир от всего плохого и убогого (по мнению Ники). 
На этой весёлой ноте мы начинаем играть. Нам нужно собрать все компоненты для сбора МехаНики (Всего их 12). Нам дан небольшой, но открытый мир, Ника, с бездонным рюкзаком и основная задача, которую я выше изложил.
Играется довольно просто и весело, даже если в игре встречается что-то не очень то и веселое. Задачки не трудны и при должном обдумывании вы быстро их решите, а если нет, то в рюкзаке главной героини всегда припасена фляжка со смесью какао и коньяка, после глотка из которой она быстр направит вас в нужную сторону.
Визуально игра воспринимается довольно приятно. Графика не блистает завораживающими видами и фотореализмом, но такой рисованный стиль придаёт игре шарм и делает её довольно милой. Музыка только дополняет картину. 
А ещё игра изобилует различными пасхалками и отсылками на объекты современной и не очень культуры, что меня очень и очень порадовало.
Из минусов? Коротка продолжительность и резкий обрыв сюжета, по традиции "на само интересном месте...".
Короче говоря, "МехаНика" - довольно милый короткий квест с незамысловатым сюжетом, который умудряется затрагивать довольно важные жизненные проблемы. Приятная картинка и музыка не оставят вас равнодушными, тем более, что игра стоит не так уж и дорого. Если любите подобные продукты или просто проекты с душой, то берите. Не пожалеете.

by Dedal333, 2016 год.

22497440.review:
아이같은 그림체로 그려진 막장 세계.

겉보기에는 '캐리와 장난감 친구들'에 소개되도 될 정도로 유아틱해 보일지도 모른다. 그러나 이 게임의 막장스러움은 딱 LISA급이다. 도대체 이런 순박한 그림체로 이런 내용의 게임을 만들 수 있나 싶을 정도. 군데군데 보이는 이 게임의 선정성은 충분히 우리의 눈쌀을 찌푸리게끔 만든다. 게임의 내용을 이해하면 이해할수록 역겨움을 느끼게 될 지도 모른다. 차라리 게임 내용 이해하지 말고 공략만 대충 보고 게임을 클리어하는걸 추천해주고 싶을 지경.

게임 자체가 그리 긴 편은 아니고 그나마 난이도도 별로 어렵진 않다. 게임 내용에 충분히 집중하고 이해할 수 있다면 무난하게 게임 마무리짓는 건 어렵지 않다. 커뮤니티 가이드 쪽에 공략도 아주 잘 되있고.

더불어 게임을 처음에 켜게 되면 다섯살 배기가 직접 작성했을 법한 꼬부랑 글씨를 접하게 된다. 가뜩이나 영어도 못하는데 글씨도 꼬부랑 꼬부랑하니 게임 내용에 대한 이해를 더욱 어렵게 만들어준다. 다행히 옵션에서 글씨를 알아볼 수 있게 설정해줄 수 있으니 어지간하면 이 설정은 꼭 바꿔주고 게임을 하자.

막장 설정에 대한 코드가 맞다면 꽤나 재밌게 즐길 수 있는 게임. 다만 유아틱해보이는 그림체에 비해 다소 혐오스러운 장면이 좀 있으니 취향이 다르다면 게임의 겉모습에 속지 말고 피하시길.

22042424.review:
Empfehlenswert, obwohl das Spiel ein paar Schwächen hat. 

Um's gleich zu sagen: 
* die Geschichte des Spiels endet mit einer Art Cliffhanger - wir können nicht miterleben, wie unsere kleine "Heldin" die Welt zerstört, sondern sehen sie nur in ihren fertigen "Mech" einsteigen. Das Spiel an und für sich besteht daraus, dass wir ihr dabei helfen, alles für diesen ihren großen Moment und Plan vorzubereiten
* das Spiel ist leider, leider recht kurz. Möglicherweise könnte man es als "Appetizer" bezeichnen. Die Fortsetzung wird auch nicht als kostenloser Patch geliefert werden, sondern ist als ein neues Spiel "Kapitel 2" geplant, so wie viele andere bekannte Adventures
* Achtung: KEIN Spiel für Kinder, auch wenn's so "aussieht" - die Videos und Screenshots dazu sollten das aber wohl schon ziemlich klar machen...

An und für sich ist das Spiel ein handelsübliches Point & Click-Adventure, gespickt voll mit schrägen und nicht jugendfreien Einfällen, untermalt mit einem eingängigen Soundtrack. Es wäre nett gewesen, noch mehr Elemente der Umgebung untersuchen und auch mal alternativ anders verwenden zu können. 

Auch die Hilfe-Funktion ist leider nicht unbedingt ernsthaft als "hilfreich" zu bezeichnen. Dass eine Sprachausgabe fehlt, fiel in meinen Augen keineswegs negativ ins Gewicht, denn möglicherweise hätten Kinderstimmen das Spiel eher nur enervierend gemacht. Die UI ist zwar mal was anderes, aber leider nicht unbedingt die beste Idee von allen. 

Trotz allem ist das Gameplay weitgehend flüssig, man kommt ganz gut durchs Spiel voran und hat auch immer mal wieder was zu lachen oder wenigstens zu schmunzeln.

22012862.review:
Short, lovely and weird, very weird.

Nika is a 7 year old girl who plans on destroying the world as we know it due to the fact that nobody gets her. And that's it, nothing more nothing less. We play as Nika in her crusade to find the items she needs to fulfill her dreams and build the ultimate machine, MechaNika, that she will use to, well, destroy us.

Art style is cute as in very cute but don't let that fool you this isn't a game for little kids, it contains some mature dialogs and scenes that would make your kid ask you some questions you don't want them asking you yet.

Pros.
Art style.
References to games and TV shows (Easter eggs)
BGM
Gameplay (really nice thinking material here)
Achievements and trading cards

Cons.
Short (like 5 mins over 2 hours, that's the time it took me to finish it and get all achievements)

Overall 9/10. I got it in a bundle and though I recommend it, i don't do it a full price.

21194086.review:
As cute as the game looks and starts out, don't be fooled into thinking that this is a game suitable for kids! There are several dark and/or mature subjects that are dealt with in the game. Also, graphic images (yes, even cartoon nudity can be 'raunchy'). I understood the creator's intention of being hilarious and shocking in a game that looks like you'd least suspect it, but playing this when there are people are not around is generally not a good idea. Unless of course you don't mind explaining yourself and the filfth that is on your screen all the time.

The game objective is fairly simple: find items to make the ultimate killing machine! The how is simple as well: get them by talking to people and/or doing this for them. It gets a bit repetative, to be honest. As long as you keep this in mind: your objective is never to open up locked area! You could finish this game very fast. There is ONE place however where all gamers appear to get stuck. Everyone knows what I'm talking about - when you've acquired a certain outfit. Gentle hint: find places to hide in WITHOUT entering a house or building. Good luck with that.

Another major disappointment is the climax that the game reaches. Nika's tension is building when you receive more items over time. You actually find yourself getting excited with her. So what is to expect when she finally manages her objective? Well, nothing much... Whether that is nothing much because Nika's plan is grander in her own mind than put to practise or because the game is just a short little indie plot, I'll leave you to discover that for yourself.

I wouldn't recommend the game. Its settings are a bit too much over-the-topness mixed together. There are so many places that are locked, that you imagine there is a lot (more) to discover, but no...closed is closed (off). Nika is much too gifted to be 6/7 or whatever, but whatever. It is the bratty and ultimate entitlement that I really dislike! There are too many ways to shock people incorporated into the game. Instead of laughing, you will just start raising your eyebrows instead. It is TOO much in very little time, so it just ends up falling flat instead. What a waste...

But, mothers, do not buy this game for your kiddies. They will not only stop believing in Santa Clause, they will find out where meat really does come from and what those scantily dressed ladies at the corner really do. And no, it's not selling candy...

20661016.review:
[h1]overall[/h1]
MechaNika feels very fresh. It's cute, twisted, lighthearted and funny. I struggle to remember the last time an adventure game was this cool. The mischievous Nika with her grand but misguided ambitions reminds me of being a kid again, while the adult references and quirky humour make it entertaining.

[h1]art[/h1]
The cartoony world is rich with cute, expressively animated characters, which plays great against the purposefully functional backgrounds. A nice touch is the addition of several short, graphic novel inspired cutscenes.

[h1]writing[/h1]
While it's frequently twisted and filled with adult themes, the playful, lighthearted tone makes these parts funny, albeit a bit crude at times.

[h1]caveats[/h1][list][*]only 2-3 hours long; not even long enough to collect the drop cards.
[*]fairly easy puzzles
[*]vulgar humour in sections
[*]weird inventory interface and some non-standard exits
[*]no voice acting
[*]story is arguably a cliffhanger (but given the tone, I didn't see it this way).
[/list]

20659329.review:
[i]Le thème de l'anti-héros n'est pas souvent abordé dans les jeux vidéo et avoir pour héroïne une gamine diabolique plutôt qu'une enfant naïve et innocente est tout aussi rare. Accrochez-vous parce que Nika débarque, avec ses outils, ses armes, son plan machiavélique et son sourire trop mimi.[/i]

La petite Nika s'ennuie beaucoup. A l'école, à la maison, personne ne prête attention à elle. Sa maitresse passe son temps à jouer sur son téléphone plutôt que de lui apprendre des choses intéressantes, sa mère est toujours fourrée dans ses gossip shows télévisés sans répondre à ses demandes d'inscription dans un cours de robotique, son père répare des motos et ne sort jamais du garage, quant à son grand-père, son seul intérêt est de reconquérir sa grand-mère. C'en est trop ! Nika prend alors une décision radicale, à l'aide de ses connaissances en mécanique elle va construire un énorme robot qui lui permettra de supprimer TOUT ce qui n'est pas cool. Son robot ? Le MechaNika !

A première vue ce jeu semble enfantin avec ses environnements simples au style mignon dessiné à la main et ses musiques douces. Grosse erreur. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=604212811 Tout du long le jeu débordera d'un humour mature, tantôt noir (Nika annonce avec un air stoïque déconcertant que sa petite sœur est morte à la naissance), tantôt graveleux (les prostituées travesties qui font des propositions indécentes à la petite fille), tantôt transgressif (Nika se saoule au cacao-cognac). Il va sans dire que le jeu se réserve exclusivement à un public adulte.

Néanmoins il n'y a pas une réelle critique de la société derrière cet humour, on ne va pas nous présenter Nika comme la pauvre petite fille délaissée par son entourage, ses parents comme des êtres qui se renferment dans des passions de façade pour oublier la douleur de la récente perte d'un enfant, ou encore son grand-père comme un vieil homme esseulé qui cherche à reconquérir l'amour de sa vie. Non, non, cet angle narratif est absent et ce n'est pas un reproche car cela change un peu d'avoir affaire à un point & click qui ose et qui surprend. Par contre, il ne plaira pas à tout le monde, on peut même dire que parfois le jeu en fait un peu trop, passant du drôle au lourdingue. 

MechaNika se présente comme un point & click 2D avec des mécaniques des plus classiques. La grande mission du jeu sera de réunir les 12 objets nécessaires à la construction du robot anéantisseur : balles, débris de verre, bidons de pétrole, scies circulaires, si le projet de Nika n'était pas encore très clair on peut voir au vu des composants de sa machine qu'elle ne compte pas faire dans la dentelle. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=604212696 Une fois qu'on aura récolté un objet il suffira de l'associer au composant correspondant pour que celui-ci soit créé. Pas d'associations complexes d'items, on reste dans du basique. La recherche d'objets est d'ailleurs très logique rendant le jeu simple d'accès au vu de sa difficulté relativement peu élevée. 

Si vous vous retrouvez tout de même coincés à un moment ou à un autre, ça peut arriver, il existe un système d'indices qui pourra vous aiguiller. [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=604430010]Dans son sac à dos Nika possède une flasque, un "mélange maison" de cacao et de cognac qui saura lui remettre les idées en place.[/url] Les indices sont rattachés aux différents lieux du monde et ainsi, selon l'endroit où elle se trouve, Nika pourra être inspirée et vous aider dans votre mission. 
Pour vous parler d'un exemple d'énigme sur laquelle vous pourriez rester bloqués, il y a un moment du jeu où vous devrez réparer une machine qui vous demandera un code d'accès. Nul besoin de chercher autour de vous, si vous ne connaissez pas les suites de Fibonacci et que le "Fibonactic" inscrit sur la-dire machine ne vous met pas sur la voie, vous allez un peu galérer. Tout le monde n'est pas tenu de connaitre ces théories mathématiques et c'est bien dommage d'inclure une énigme dont la solution ne se découvre pas in-game.

Le style visuel de MechaNika est simple, cartoonesque, soigneusement dessiné à la main et offre des environnements agréables, correctement fournis en détails. http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=604212727 Pour un jeu que je savais court (comptez 2 à 4h, pas plus), j'ai été ravie de voir qu'il y avait tout de même un nombre satisfaisant de lieux différents. Les animations vont de pair avec le style épuré et restent basiques mais les expressions de Nika sont malgré tout variées, drôles et mignonnes. 
La musique est douce et colle bien à l'univers visuel qui a été créé sans être mémorable cependant, on reste dans de la composition rudimentaire avec des thèmes peu nombreux qui vont se répéter pendant toute la durée du jeu.

La galerie de personnage est haute en couleurs et plutôt sympathique, ça tombe bien car une suite est prévue avec cette fois non plus Nika dans le rôle de l'héroïne mais Agatha, une petite bien barrée elle aussi avec son amour de la viande, son travail de bouchère et sa religion inventée, le "Carnivorisme". Ça promet !

Pour conclure, MechaNika sert un peu d'introduction à un univers qui connaitra des suites encore plus loufoques que ce premier jeu ne l'est déjà. S'il y a une question qu'il faut vous poser avant de vous lancer c'est bien évidemment : cet humour est-il fait pour moi ? C'est vrai que le studio Mango Protocol n'y va pas de main morte, au premier coup d’œil on ne s'attend certainement pas à un jeu qui se réserve aux adultes mais l'univers est si farfelu, les personnages sont si excentriques et le scénario tellement invraisemblable que la recette fonctionne. Personnellement, j'ai pas mal accroché et la suite a l'air prometteuse, il me tarde d'y jouer !

20482050.review:
生まれた時から分解好きでメカキチなニカちゃん、大人たちの日頃の理不尽な言動に嫌気がさし前々から計画していたメカニカロジェクト、"世界を破滅に導き自らの手で理想の世界を作り出す"、という壮大な計画に着手する事にしました。
そのプロジェクトの根幹を成すある物を作るためにまずは街に落ちてるいろいろな [strike]ガラクタ[/strike] 物を集めないと・・・といった感じのアドベンチャーゲームです。 

ゲーム自体はよくあるポイント＆クリック式のＡＤＶですが、描画がシンプルで目的の物がわかりやすい事、移動できるマップ数が少ないこと、ニカちゃんの動きが意外と軽快な事から、この手のゲームにありがちな何度も同じところを行ったり来たりしてクリックする煩わしさはそれほど感じませんでした。
若干解りにくかったのはインベントリ画面でのアイテム使用方法でしょうか。
インベントリ画面からマップ画面は持ち物を出す方法、目的となキーアイテムを持ち物から作り出す方法はぱっと見では少し解りにくいかもしれません。（といってもそれでもただクリックするだけなんですが）
冒頭でニカちゃんが全部きちんと説明してくれるのでちゃんと読んでおきましょう。

ずばりこのゲームの肝はニカちゃんのクールで皮肉みえた台詞回し、それと若干日本インスパイアされたオタク的な世界観でしょうか。
冒頭のニカちゃん兄貴の言動や部屋の様子を見てニヤリとしたり、自称48歳童貞のガンダムコスのおっさんにクスっと笑えられるなそこそこ楽しめる内容だと思います。
逆にそういいった事に面白さを見出せず、ニカちゃんのシニカルな世界観を楽しめないと、かわいい絵の割には下品な内容と描写にちょっと辟易するかもしれません。

実績は普通にプレイしていればほとんどがｄ取れるような作りになっています。私が最初のプレイで取れなかった実績はお兄ちゃんの靴下実績とノーヒント実績のみでした。靴下実績は2つあり排他実績となってるのでセーブをうまく使わないと一度のプレイで取得するのは難しいでしょう。ヒントも使わずとも普通にクリアできそうですが、ヒントを思いつ時のニカちゃんの飲酒動作もかわいいので一度目は普通にプレイしたほうがいいでしょう。セーブリセットでまた始めからプレイしても、アイテム集めを把握していて台詞を全部スキップすれば10分や20分程度でエンディングに辿り着ける程度のボリュームですので。

総プレイ時間はカード出し放置や翻訳しながらの寝落ち(笑）を除いて10時間程度でしょうか。
私は英語でわかりづらいところを自動翻訳にかけながらプレイしましたが、普通に英語がわかる方ならきっちり台詞を楽しみつつでもたぶん4~5時間、ざっくり内容を把握しながらのプレイなら2～3時間程度でクリアできるかもしれません。

グッズキャラクターのようなシンプルでかわいい絵柄に惹かれた方、それにニカちゃんのクールな言動と下品な内容に耐えられる方には非常にお勧めできるゲームだと思います（笑）。


ちなみにデベロッパー公式ではニカちゃんとその親友アガサのかわいいグッズ（バッグやＴシャツなど）が販売されております。
日本からだと送料がそこそこかかってしまいそうですが、ニカちゃんの見た目にはまってしまった人はぜひ一度見てみる事をおすすめします。なかなかかわいいグッズがそろってますよ。
Mango Protocol [url=http://mangoprotocol.bigcartel.com/]http://mangoprotocol.bigcartel.com/[/url]

MechaNika是一個黑色幽默點擊解謎的小遊戲
別看這畫風看似可愛，但是裡面包涵的東西絕對是成人觀賞，一開始購買的原因是因為他的畫風吸引我，有一種小畫家的感覺，不過她帶出的風格真的蠻變態的就是了

遊戲敘事：

雖然遊戲中有很多好像是在諷刺現世的一些場景和人物，不過劇情上不討論深度議題，反正就是要毀滅世界

MechaNika advertises itself as a light-hearted, all-ages-friendly, short little game, and thematically, that's pretty accurate; it's hard not to have fun with this game, its simply but comically well-done artstyle, and its many references to contemporary internet culture. Players will quickly find, however, the very blatant adult elements that make this game inadvisable for exposure to its seemingly intended market audience.

The protagonist is a 7-year old girl fed up with her environment, and determined to make use of her extensive knowledge of engineering to put an end to everything not awesome. 19857296.review:
¿Es que nadie piensa en los niños?

Los chicos de Mango Protocol nos traen una aventura gráfica muy peculiar. Descaradamente el juego llama la atención por su apartado artístico inusual y unos diálogos originales saltándose las reglas de lo establecido correctamente. Esto aporta una bocanada de aire fresco que de cuando en cuando se agradece entre otras tantas aventuras que presumen de preciosismo, efectos digitales 3D, o tramas muy elaboradas de las que escriben trilogías bíblicas.
En nuestra breve aventura ayudaremos a Nika, una niña pequeña con pensamientos muy adultos y retorcidos. Ella quiere destruir todo aquello que no mola y arrasar el mundo a resumidas cuentas. En nuestra andadura para ver si logramos o no llegar a este fin, conoceremos a personajes de los más variopintos, tanto entrañables como siniestros y estrambóticos con todo lo divertido y único que esto supone.
Puede que sus 2 horas de duración (jugando con tranquilidad) parezcan insuficientes pero hay que prestar atención a su ridículo precio asequible a cualquier bolsillo. 
Después de todo es un juego para pasar un rato agradable, del cual acabarás satisfecho y con una que otra sonrisa dibujada en tu cara.

Los mejor: relación calidad/precio. Muy divertido en situaciones y comentarios chistosos. Único en su especie. Rejugable para sacar logros.
Lo peor: desaprovecha la oportunidad de conquistarnos con muchos más chistes frikis a la largo de su corta historia. A los jugadores más conservadores no les resultará atractivo el estilo visual.

19782054.review:
Nika Allen is a  seven year old child genius in world that she despises. Being a genius she has the capability to do what we can't do when we are disillusioned about the way we live: Destroy it if course! I thought children were supposed to be untouched by the cynicism and bitterness we feel about the world today from our teenage years...

 This is a point and click game where you will help sweet little Nika gather the items she needs. In case you miss this if you double click on Nika she will run like her life depended on it. The art is not anything to write home about. Despite the simple, drawn childlike style this is a game designed with adults in mind. In fact the choice of art style is good choice for MechaNika because it lightens the dark undertones and humour in the game. Give this plot to another developer and we would be reviewing a horror game not a short point and click.

The strength of this game is its dark humour dialogue. The references to subjects such as gaming and anime will give the player a chuckle. I would like to think there is some deeper meaning to this game as it touches lightly on the themes such as addiction. Maybe it's a commentary on the perception that the developer sees the world he lives in. 
This game is the first by Mango Protocol and was voted through Greenlight. I missed this one but based on this game I will put my vote in for the next one they produce. This game is worth your time and money, especially if you like point and click games.

19738367.review:
Don't let the cute art style fool you, this game is not for kids, what with the dark comedy and (brief) depictions of gore and nudity. This is first and foremost a point-and-click game for adults.

7-year-old Nika Allen is a child prodigy of sorts, being quite the tinkerer with electronics and mechanical devices. She is also more mature than her age, knowing a lot more about the world than the usual 7-year-old girl. She drinks a concoction of cognac and cocoa (underage drinking, ahoy!) to inspire herself and help her 'see things clearer'. Her goal? To create a giant mech to destroy all the things 'that aren't awesome' and to eventually 'take over the world'. Hoo boy, don't get on this little girl's bad side, let me tell you.

My only real complaint with the game is how short it is. It took me two hours to beat, and I normally hope to get twice that at the very least from a point-and-click adventure. Still, those two hours were very enjoyable, filled with solid PnC puzzle solving and plenty of dark, wacky shenanigans.

At full price, yeah, this game is certainly worth it. Still, I think you should pick this up when it is on sale, if only to feel as if you got a little more bang for your little buck.

19479008.review:
MechaNika is a short, but quite good and entertaining point & click adventure. It looks like a game made for children, with its simple yet charming visuals, but is definitely aimed at adults, with some quite twisted and dark humour in it.

Nika is a young, intelligent girl, frustrated by the world around her. So she plans the invention of MechaNika, a giant robot with which she wants to take revenge on the whole world and destroy everything that is not awesome. Help her assemble all necessary parts and get to see yourself all of those hilarious things not awesome. Meet hobos with cats in their beards, male pro*stitutes and Martyr Pig, who sacrificed itself to show us how good sausages are, amongst other unusual characters.

Controls are simple, as you would expect from a point & click adventure game, puzzles are logical and not too easy at times. The humour is often quite black and great. Graphics sometimes look a bit amateurish, but have a distinct and likeable style. The music is not outstanding, but still quite good.

The only downsides, if you want to call them downsides, are that the game is very short indeed and options are more or less non-existent. It's a mobile port with low resolution, but with the choice of style for the graphics, it doesn't matter much.

Considering its length, pick it up in a decent sale for a price tag that reflects the mobile price. Having said that, it is still worth the normal, already quite low price. If you are into point & click adventures, odds are you are going to enjoy it. Probably a lot.

If you're looking for something long or difficult, seek elsewhere.

J'ai eu du plaisir à y jouer à ce Point&Click. On y incarne Nika, une fille très 
perceptive pour son âge et amoureux des mécaniques. L'objectif: réaliser le projet MechaNika.
L'univers, bien que courte, y est très riche et son design graphic le rend unique, je trouve.
Attention, ne vous dites pas parceque ça fait "dessin d'enfant" que ce jeu est destiné à ce public, ce n'est pas un monde tout rose, suffit de voir les screens...
La durée de vie du jeu dépendra de votre façon de jouer. Votre 2ème partie paraitra affreusement courte par rapport à la 1ère, il faudra bien finir le jeu 2 fois au minimum pour gagner tout les succès.
L'interaction avec le monde qui vous entoure, VOTRE CULTURE (irl) et résoudre un certains nombres d'énigmes sera de mise pour mener votre projet à bien.

Oh, et n'hésitez pas à dire bonjour à Agatha, héroine du jeu "Agatha Knife", basé sur le même univers que Mechanika. ;)

I thought I'd give this a shot since it was cheap and it looked fairly cute.
I really wished my shot had missed.
I can understand a small kid wanting to destroy the world because she sees it as being unfair and wrong,
But what I can't get is that the whole game's premise is based off of that.
Okay, the game throws in easter eggs and references to other games and the art style is cute,
Yet some of the puzzles are a bit tricky and don't offer any guidance as to how the puzzles are solved.
Sadly, I just couldn't find myself liking the game enough to keep it in my game library.
I suppose it's alright if you want easy achievements and for younger players,

19271846.review:
Yeah, it's pretty good I guess. If you're thinking about picking it up, I'd say do it for the art and writing. The store page screenshots do a pretty good job showcasing that aspect of the game, so if they interest you then great, otherwise maybe don't pick it up. MechaNika's puzzles are sort of interesting too, but it's still essentially just your run of the mill point and click gameplay. Not saying the puzzles aren't neat or whatever, but they mostly just serve as a mechanic to get you out in the game world and explore (which isn't a bad thing at all). The soundtrack is alright too, but again, it's not really that special. It helps certain areas set the atmosphere, but beyond that it's not really that memorable.

My only notable gripe with this game is that the story doesn't exactly feel finished despite not it *definitely* not ending on a cliffhanger. The devs have talked in the discussion forums about making another game in the same world, so if having a full fledged condensed story also matters to you, maybe wait a bit on this series.

19256868.review:
An inexpensive and entertaining point and click puzzle game where you assist a 7 year old girl with her plans for total world domination. The game is also fairly short, which saves it from overstaying its welcome. The humor is dark (in a good way) in most of the game, though it ventures now and then into cheap gutter humor in a way that is less than endearing.

Pros: 
* Accurately depicts school life
* Finally a game that provides a positive portrayal of carnivorism
* A proactive protagonist who is genuinely committed to solving the problems of the modern world instead of whining about them
* The way the art style is done adds a lot of character to the game

Cons:
* Occasional bouts of gutter humor (the whole prostitute sequence - really?)
* Creators appearing in their own world to talk about how awesome they are
* Puzzles aren't too complicated (this may or may not be a con)

It should also be noted that like most humor, your level of tolerance is going to vary spectacularly.

19239448.review:
I got the Hidden Gems bundle because I was interested in this game. I've always liked point n click adventure games, as I played a lot of them, such as the Reincarnation series, back in the day on websites like NewGrounds. If you're looking for a long game like Deponia, this isn't it. This is more akin to those previously-mentioned games on NewGrounds and Kongregate. 

MechaNika is about a young girl who has a pretty rough life. Your quest is to find parts to destroy everything she hates, basically. If you get stuck, you can get wasted and she'll give you a hint. There's a lot of fun little quirks in the game that you can interact with, that may or may not actually impact the story. You can complete most of it in any order you please.

I got it for $2.99 and I feel it was worth my money. If you want a more complete story, you might wait until MangoProtocol makes more in this series, but they have said the rest won't be point n click. But if you're looking for another fun little (dark) point n click game, this might fit your bill.

[b]MechaNika[/b] [i]es un juego basado en Nika, una niña de 7 años adicta al Coñac con Cacao que es expulsada de la escuela durante 1 semana en la cuál, al estar harta de todas las cosas que no molan intentará fabricar a MechaNika, un ser desconocido que hará que el mundo sea suyo y esté hecho a su gusto, así es que no os engáñeis, pese a unas  gráficas simples y una letra hecha por un niño de no más de 5 años estamos ante un señor juegazo.[/i]

[h1]Gráficos[/h1]
[i]Gráficamente hablando el juego ofrece mucho, es un point & click, tampoco se puede pedir mucho más de lo que ofrece, sin embargo la ambientación le da un punto humorístico al juego y entre todo le da un "toque" que te deja satisfecho en éste aspecto.[/i]

[h1]Historia[/h1]
[i]Cómo dije arriba, no os dejéis engañar, estamos frente a un señor juegazo que te va a  dar unas horas de diversión sin límites, la historia está muy elaborada, es un juego que está hecho para que lo puedan disfrutar tanto niños cómo adultos, ya que contiene humor para todas las edades y el humor para adultos que tiene no considero que pueda hacerle daño verlo a ningún niño, de hecho creo que ni lo entenderían, es una historia muy completa con la que te mantendrás entretenid@.[/i]

[h1]Jugabilidad[/h1]
[i]La jugabilidad no es el aspecto más destacable de éste juego al ser un point & click, empiezas el juego y tras un breve tutorial una vez en tu casa te darán una lista de objetos que  debes conseguir para completar tu propósito recorriendo la ciudad.[/i]


[i]Pese a pecar por su duración al ser relativamente corto es un juego que os recomiendo a tod@s  totalmente, ya que te lograrás divertir mucho con el y está bastante completo, a mi me ha dado 3 horas de risas en las que me divertí bastante, vale la pena pagar su precio, totalmente recomendado.[/i]


[h1]Nota final: 8 de 10[/h1]

18078325.review:
This is a cute and fun little game. Don't be fooled by its innocent art style, though, it's quite dark and intended for a mature audience. You got a 7 year old whose secret concoction is cognac and coacoa, who is basically invisible to her dysfunctional family. 

You play as Nika, a little girl who is bored and tired of school, and basically the whole world. She devises a plan to create MechaNika; a super mech that she can use to purge the world of things that are not awesome. I'm not very far in the game, but I guess that's where it's headed.

The puzzles are very easy, you can collect items for her project quite easily. This is a fun and relaxing game to play to squeeze the last bit of your intellect after a long day at work, and not a game for intensely cryptic puzzles. The story and dialogue are fun and cute, and I look forward to more games from the Psychotic's world.

18068099.review:
MechaNika is a funny point & click, where you play a seven year old girl that plans to destroy the world.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fdLmzTmphYA
It's a very simple game to play, but the gameplay isn't the attraction. It's the funny dialogue, and characters.

Nika tends to be smarter than everyone around her, so when interacting with other people, you get the option to mess with them, or question them, and it gets pretty humorous. 
There's a girl who wears an eyepatch and calls herself pirate girl, and a kid in the playground that makes a living from being a dealer. As in, weapons dealer. Yes, the game has some funny darker stuff like this too.

The game's art style looks really cute, and isn't ruined by any HUD. You access your inventory and menus by clicking on the character, so the game looks pretty clean. If you get stuck, you can drink fro her flask, containing a special concoction. She'll give a vague enough hint for the game to still be fun incase you're really stumped. It's a nice option to have.

The music is really great as well. It adds to the atmosphere in different places.

Overall, it's a fun, and very cheap game. So if you're a fan of point & clicks or this type of humor, check it out!

17455338.review:
http://niveloculto.com/analisis-mechanika

Uno de los aspectos más atractivos del panorama independiente hoy día es que, gracias a empresas como Telltale Games, Daedalic Entertainment, se está recuperando el género de la aventura gráfica (o el Point & Click) que cayó durante una buena temporada en el olvido tras vivir la época de auge que se conoció como la edad dorada de las aventuras gráficas. Los que peinamos cierta cantidad de canas recordamos con cariño todo lo que tiene que ver con la ya difunta LucasArts (Monkey Island, Indiana Jones, etcétera) o cualquiera de las grandes editoras de aventuras gráficas y se podía decir que cada uno tenía su fetiche (en mi caso eran los dos Simon The Sorcerer).

La realidad es que a día de hoy a mí personalmente me falta paciencia para sentarme largas horas delante del ordenador a intentar darme cuenta de que vestir conejo con sombrero es la solución para pasar por delante de aquel ogro con unas babuchas de conejito sin hacer ruido.

Es aquí donde posiblemente los dispositivos móviles y, en concreto, el trabajo de Mango Protocol con este Psychotic’s MechaNika brilla con fuerza.

La niña del diablo

MechaNika es una despreocupada y breve (sobre todo breve) aventura gráfica pero con una carga muy importante de crítica social (más o menos acertada en algunas ocasiones). Encarnas el papel de Nika, una niña muy inteligente que no encaja en la sociedad actual. Madres amantes de los programas de cotilleos, hermanos que juegan el papel de niño rata enganchados al Call of Duty de turno, abuelos divorciados, profesores que pasan del alumnado en pro de estar todo el día cotilleando las redes sociales, son algunos de los ejemplos que MechaNika quiere destacar y realzar de forma exagerada pero divertida.

El planteamiento es simple, pese a la carga emocional que puede llevar detrás: debemos ayudar a Nika a construir MechaNika, el robot definitivo con el que pretende acabar con la sociedad actual tal y como la conocemos. Para ello deberemos recolectar los doce artilugios del mapa que la misma Nika ha diseñado haciendo uso de nuestro ingenio, cómo no. En nuestra maleta guardaremos aquello que vayamos cogiendo o intercambiando a lo largo de la aventura. Dichos objetos podremos utilizarlos para combinarlos con el escenario o para dárselo a los personajes de la aventura (a cada cual más rocambolesco). Además, podremos hablar con estos personajes y se nos dará en muchos momentos la posibilidad de elegir qué decir.

Aunque la aventura es lineal, algunas acciones podemos llevarlas a cabo de distintas formas para conseguir lograr un fin determinado (como por ejemplo, entregarle el mando de la televisión a nuestra madre para que se vaya a ver los programas de cotilleos o simplemente encender y cambiar de canal para que lo oiga y acuda a lobotomizar su cerebro delante de la caja tonta).

Algunas de las situaciones que plantea MechaNika me han resultado excesivamente estúpidas o exageradas: hay una niña que tiene por religión el carnivorismo, un poco como lo contrario del veganismo y se dedica a convencer a los animales para que se dejen asesinar y despedazar porque dice que en su estómago es donde más seguros están o la pelea entre el abuelo y la abuela de Nika, que no quiere saber nada de él porque en su día lo pilló cepillándose a una cabra.

Crítica social rocambolesca

En resumen, MechaNika es un título más bien pensado para disfrutar en dispositivos móviles y si eres lo suficientemente audaz, puedes acabártelo en poco más de media hora. Está lleno de crítica social dentro de un marco con aspecto infantiloide para restarle un poco de hierro a los asuntos que trata. Lo tenéis ya disponible tanto para iOS y Android como para Steam (Windows, Mac OSX y Linux), al módico precio de 3,99€. Una buena solución para invertir momentos de espera en la consulta del dentista o mientras esperas a que llegue la guagua puesto que la mayoría de los puzzles son de fácil resolución.

17138571.review:
На первый взгляд MechaNika выглядит предназначенной для детей, но это не так. Игра только для взрослых, не иначе, потому что она поднимает далеко не детские темы. 

Играть предстоит за Нику Аллен [7-летний вундеркинд и фанат Бэтмена в одном лице], которая захотела уничтожить всё отстойное в мире. Встреча с ней происходит на уроке в школе, где дети пишут контрольную работу, а учитель уткнулся носом в свой телефон и видно, что она безучастна к происходящему вокруг. Прямо в классе Ника показывает и объясняет азы игры, что выглядит довольно мило и необычно. Закончив такое обучение, можно приступать к миссии №1, но сначала нужно вытащить Нику из школы, что, безусловно, оказалось просто. Кстати, сама школа от тюрьмы мало чем отличается…

Добравшись до дома не самым лучшим способом, Ника знакомит со своим планом, для выполнения которого предстоит искать кучу вещей на протяжении всей игры. Выйдя из комнаты, можно встретить старшего брата Ники, Денниса, который сутки напролёт торчит в мире видеоигр (фигурка Гарруса!!!), бестолковую мать, обезумевшую от телешоу и с тонной косметики на лице, отца, увлечённо работающего в гараже, который должен понимать интерес Ники к механике, но всё равно считающий её ещё маленькой (и это так). Даже дедушку и бабушку особо не волнует их внучка, но сама Ника помогает решить взрослым свои конфликты (причина весьма серьёзной оказалась и одновременно дикой D:). Таким образом, семейным нет никакого дела до малышки. Ника предоставлена сама себе, неудивительно, что она решила кардинальным методом изменить мир.

Выход на улицу тоже не спасает: толпы нормальных «неправильных» людей встречаются на каждом шагу, среди которых [spoiler]45-летние девственники, candy girls, наркодилеры, элитные проститутки, сатанисты. [/spoiler]Они шокируют. Даже единственный друг Ники не без странностей. Но для успешного выполнения миссии  с каждым элементом общества стоит разговаривать (ради лулзов тоже). Становится понятным, зачем Ника помимо важных деталей в своём рюкзаке отдельное место выделила под флягу с горячительным напитком. При первом прохождении я выбрала линию стрейт эйджа, при втором только один раз пригубила пойло, а при третьем намереваюсь после каждой встречи с людьми спаивать Нику. Посмотрю на её реакцию @_@

Мультяшная графика с 16-битной музыкой оставляют приятные эмоции. Игра изначально выпускалась для мобильных устройств, но даже на ПК сделали некоторую анимацию (в моём любимом Дарке у npc губы неподвижны, а здесь шевелятся!).

Геймплей – классический point’n’click, с разной степенью загадок. Ради одной пришлось стучаться в гугл, про числа Фибоначчи раньше даже не слышала! На протяжении всех 3 часов, которые я потратила на первое прохождение, ни разу не заскучала: проходится живо и интересно.

[b]Итог:[/b] MechaNika – уникальная игра, в которой жестокость пересекается с тонкой иронией, и если смотреть на это с точки зрения здравого человека, то она принесёт кучу положительных эмоций.  Разработчики, на мой взгляд, захотели показать современные реалии общества, но я искренне надеюсь, что большинство населения Земли состоит из таких людей, как Ника.

17094676.review:
I was intrigued to play this, as my hope was that it would be like Willy Beamish with a dark, clever sense of humour. The trailer showed a teacher ignoring her young students - who drink booze out of hip flasks - as she played games on her cellphone. I was optimistic.

Sadly, all of this over-the-top excess is for nought. Extreme vulgarity for its own sake doesn't ring out as anything but cheap shock, and I'm afraid this is all MechaNika has to offer.

If all it takes to entertain you is that somebody 'fucks goats' devoid of any context or connection to anything within the game, then by all means: Have a great time. The art, music and production elements are all perfectly fine. The puzzles are very easy, and guidance is always available in-game.

Just don't go into it expecting something that uses its own crassness in any kind of interesting way.

17079032.review:
Я думаю тот факт, что данную игру назвали одной из лучших игр этого года на iOS и Android, уже должен привлекать немало внимания. 

И действительно. Это классический квест, выполненный в детском сеттинге с совсем недетской историей. Игра затрагивает многие проблемы современного общества, среди которых безответственность взрослых и гипоопека (когда дети предоставлены сами себе). Хотя игра, в целом, отображает последствия гипоопеки. Она отвечает на вопрос: Что происходит с детьми, когда они предоставлены сами себе? И отвечает она на него отнюдь не скучно и заунывно (как я в моём обзоре), а весело и с юмором, элементами сатиры. 

В общем, могу посоветовать данную игру любителям юмористических квестов. Цена тоже доставила много приятных эмоций, таки да. 

И, для русскоязычных, покуда я пишу обзор на русском языке. В данный момент мы занимаемся переводом этой игры. Информацию о переводе вы можете найти по запросу: "Zone of games MechaNika", - загляните в тему на форуме и увидите прогресс перевода. (На момент написания обзора 16.07.2015: 12%)

17077481.review:
Antes de nada, aviso de que este juego también está disponible en Google Play y iTunes a mitad de precio que en Steam.

No sabía nada de este juego hasta ayer, día antes de su lanzamiento en Steam, lo encontré ojeando la lista de próximos lanzamientos. Siempre me han gustado las aventuras gráficas 2D con toques de humor y situaciones absurdas. Me llamó la atención el estilo artístico simple e infantil, y el hecho de que a pesar de eso el juego contiene muchos elementos adultos (si veis las capturas de la página de la tienda o el tráiler lo podréis comprobar), También me fijé en que es un videjuego español, aunque es un equipo desarrollador desconocido, siempre está bien apoyar al producto patrio, así que esta mañana he decidido comprarlo viendo que el precio es razonable.

Es un juego de corta duración, se necesitan apenas unas 2 horas para completarlo, algo más si quieres hacer el 100% de los logros. Pero la verdad es que cada minuto lo vale, los diálogos son entretenidos y los escenarios agradabales de explorar, el juego no se hace pesado pues es difícil quedarse atascado. También está todo muy cargado de referencias a otras cosas, algunas más sutiles que otras, que lo hacen todo más ameno.

En resumen,

Lo bueno:
· Estilo artístico original y llamativo.
· Humor y situaciones absurdas y adultas.
· Puzzles normalitos, no te vas a quedar atascado (además hay una opción de pistas en tal caso).
· Muchos personajillos variados y entrañables.
· Referencias de todo tipo.
· Precio razonable.

Lo no tan bueno:
· Un poco corto, el final sobre todo te deja con ganas de más.
· Algunos escenarios están muy llenos de detalles visualmente hablando, pero apenas puedes interactuar con muy pocas cosas, he echado en falta algo más de diálogos e interacción en este sentido, aunque fuera de relleno.

En conclusión, este juego la verdad es que es amor, una pequeña gran aventura gráfica para pasar un par de horas, estaré al tanto de los próximos juegos de esta gente.
